channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: In upstate New York, the shutdown means hunger and hard choices
item.description: From Saranac Lake, Emily Russell of North Country Public Radio reports on how families are scrambling to get by as vital aid programs remain frozen.
item.content:encoded: From Saranac Lake, Emily Russell of North Country Public Radio reports on how families are scrambling to get by as vital aid programs remain frozen.
item.dc:creator: Emily Russell

item.title: As the shutdown drags on, Senator Klobuchar urges action
item.description: Sen. Amy Klobuchar of Minnesota says Democrats are united on affordability and calls on the president to help end the shutdown.
item.content:encoded: Sen. Amy Klobuchar of Minnesota says Democrats are united on affordability and calls on the president to help end the shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Avery Keatley

item.title: How one athlete changed the story for Indian cricket
item.description: India's new heroine is a come-back-kid who led her cricket team to world victory. She's also a target for Hindu extremists because she wears her Christianity on her sleeve
item.content:encoded: India's new heroine is a come-back-kid who led her cricket team to world victory. She's also a target for Hindu extremists because she wears her Christianity on her sleeve
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: Writing radio obituaries is an art of its own
item.description: NPR's reporters on the choices and challenges of writing obituaries.
item.content:encoded: NPR's reporters on the choices and challenges of writing obituaries.
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Pierre

item.title: The next battle for Austin's music scene is against the algorithms
item.description: KUT's Miles Bloxson and Elizabeth McQueen explore how Austin musicians are adapting to AI and the changing music industry.
item.content:encoded: KUT's Miles Bloxson and Elizabeth McQueen explore how Austin musicians are adapting to AI and the changing music industry.
item.dc:creator: Mallory Yu

item.title: Israeli settlers and soldiers are redrawing the map of the West Bank
item.description: As the world looks to Gaza, settlers in the West Bank are seizing land and terrorizing villages with impunity.
item.content:encoded: As the world looks to Gaza, settlers in the West Bank are seizing land and terrorizing villages with impunity.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: CRISPR gene-editing works to reduce high cholesterol in a new study
item.description: An experimental gene-editing treatment shows promise for permanently lowering levels of cholesterol and triglycerides, possibly helping cut the risk for heart disease.
item.content:encoded:
An experimental gene-editing treatment shows promise for permanently lowering levels of cholesterol and triglycerides, possibly helping cut the risk for heart disease.

(Image credit: TEK IMAGE/Science Photo Library)
item.dc:creator: Rob Stein

item.title: Recruiting companies are starting to hold job interviews using AI
item.description: Companies have begun using AI to interview potential employees, and a new study shows a number of job candidates may prefer being interviewed by AI.
item.content:encoded: Companies have begun using AI to interview potential employees, and a new study shows a number of job candidates may prefer being interviewed by AI.
item.dc:creator: Wailin Wong

item.title: New licensing deal highlights the growing trend of media giants embracing AI
item.description: The AI entertainment landscape is starting to shift, with deals springing up between formerly adversarial AI companies and entertainment corporations, especially in the music space.
item.content:encoded: The AI entertainment landscape is starting to shift, with deals springing up between formerly adversarial AI companies and entertainment corporations, especially in the music space.
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: James Watson, who co-discovered the structure of DNA, has died at age 97
item.description: James Watson, who co-discovered the structure of DNA has died at age 97. He was a scientific superstar until he made racist remarks that made him an outcast.
item.content:encoded:
James Watson, who co-discovered the structure of DNA has died at age 97. He was a scientific superstar until he made racist remarks that made him an outcast.

(Image credit: J. Conrad Williams, Jr./Newsday)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce
